channel.title: Server on the web? :D
channel.description: im using ifastnet.com and i would like to know how i can get my server on the so people can play. i believe what im trying to do is use a webclient? but i have no idea how to do it. would i have to take my server and jar it? can i just put it up there? i have no idea :s. also, im using a source where i cant edit the port and ip on it. i dont know how im supposed to do this lol. its just for me and 1-2 friends, its basically 100% leeched, but all credit goes to him. i dont want the credit i just want me and my friend to play. help? :-D

item.title: Server on the web? :D
item.dc:creator: @Word_Life Word Life
item.description:
@Word_Life wrote:

[quote=“me caveman, post:3, topic:357607”][quote author=Word Life link=topic=454124.msg3325839#msg3325839 date=1283101431]

im using ifastnet.com and i would like to know how i can get my server on the so people can play. i believe what im trying to do is use a webclient? but i have no idea how to do it. would i have to take my server and jar it? can i just put it up there? i have no idea :s. also, im using a source where i cant edit the port and ip on it. i dont know how im supposed to do this lol. its just for me and 1-2 friends, its basically 100% leeched, but all credit goes to him. i dont want the credit i just want me and my friend to play. help?

I don’t know the full detail, but I know you’re supposed to jar your client, not the server. I’m sure there is a tutorial for this on here or r u n e - s e r v e r.
[/quote]

hmm ill look but its very confusing trying to read guides for many cases, you know what i mean?[/quote]

Yea. When I first started coding a couple years back, it was kinda hard. But then it got easier to go along. Now it’s hard again since I had quit with all this those “couple years back”.

Read full topic
